Package FBLAQuiz

Class MultipleSelect

java.lang.Object
java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
FBLAQuiz.MultipleSelect
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.util.EventListener
public class MultipleSelect
extends java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener

Multiple Select Question Class

The MultipleSelect class creates an object representing a multiple select question and implements methods for dealing with such.
Author:
Varun Unnithan

  • Constructor Details

    • MultipleSelect

      public MultipleSelect() throws java.io.IOException, org.json.simple.parser.ParseException, java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Default constructor for creating a random question
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - On input error
      org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - On error while parsing the database
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - On failure to find database file path

    • createPanel

      public javax.swing.JPanel createPanel​(int questionNumber, javax.swing.JFrame frame)
      Creates a JPanel which includes GUI components to add to a JFrame to ask a multiple select question
      Parameters:
      questionNumber - The question's number within the quiz
      frame - The JFrame upon which this JPanel will be added
      Returns:
      JPanel object to be added to the JFrame to pose a multiple select question
